bug.author: Jxu-Thu
bug.summary: WSJ dataset processing error - AttributeError: 'Namespace' object has no attribute 'etype'
bug.description:
When run the run.sh at espnet/egs/wsj/asr1/run.sh, run this command local/filtering_samples.py \ --config ${train_config} \ --preprocess-conf ${preprocess_config} \ --data-json ${feat_tr_dir}/data.json \ --mode-subsample "asr" \ --arch-subsample "rnn" \ ${min_io_delta:+--min-io-delta $min_io_delta} \ --output-json-path ${feat_tr_dir}/data.json get this error Traceback (most recent call last): File "local/filtering_samples.py", line 65, in args, mode=args.mode_subsample, arch=args.arch_subsample File "/mypath/espnet/espnet/nets/pytorch_backend/nets_utils.py", line 411, in get_subsample if train_args.etype.endswith("p") and not train_args.etype.startswith("vgg"): AttributeError: 'Namespace' object has no attribute 'etype' I print the args parameters and do not find the 'etype'. And why arch-subsample is rnn? this script run the asr model with transformer?
espnet/egs/wsj/asr1/run.sh
Line 149 in 74de653
--arch-subsample "rnn" \

comments.comment: You are right, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/espnet/espnet/blob/master/egs/wsj/asr1/run.sh#L149>espnet/egs/wsj/asr1/run.sh#L149</denchmark-link> should not specify explicitly. It should be determined by the architecture in the model conf. For a quick fix, could you try changing to to make it work?

I just made a PR to fix this issue. Now the argument is removed, and it will be parsed from in the config file. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jxu-Thu>@Jxu-Thu</denchmark-link> , Could you try it?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jxu-Thu>@Jxu-Thu</denchmark-link> , please let me know if it solves the problem. Then, Iâ€™ll merge <denchmark-link:https://github.com/espnet/espnet/issues/2211>#2211</denchmark-link>
